meta.title: Coronavirus COVID-19 Information Page - Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95

meta.name: description
meta.content: Coronavirus COVID-19 Information Page - Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Coronavirus COVID-19 Information Page, Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95
Coronavirus COVID-19 Information Page - Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95
Coronavirus COVID-19 Information Page - Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasRightBanner fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection333 fsHasTheme2

img.alt: Lake Zurich Community Unit School District

li.a: Find the District and snapshot calendar?
Find the staff directory for all district staff?
Add money to my student's lunch account?
Report a security concern, bullying, or other issue?

br.a: Watch a live broadcast of a Board meeting?

div.p: This page is designed to provide District 95 parents, students, and staff, the latest information regarding the Coronavirus COVID-19 in our area. Please be aware that we will update this page regularly with the most current information as we receive it from local, regional, State, or other authorities.
div.div: On April 23, 2020, Governor J.B. Pritzker extended the Stay at Home order for Illinois residents through May 30th, 2020. District 95 activities and events for the month of May are cancelled.

div.p: On April 17, 2020, Governor J.B. Pritzker issued an order that all Illinois schools remain closed for the remainder of this school year. District 95 students will continue with eLearning plans for the rest of the 2019-20 school year.

div.h4: Food Support for Those in Need
div.p: ST. VINCENT DE PAUL FOOD PANTRY - On Thursday evenings at the St. Francis Ministry Center from 6:00 – 7:15 p.m. Please note, the Harvest Room Sunday evening dinners have been suspended indefinitely at this time.

THE CHAPEL - LAKE ZURICH - 330 S. Old Rand Rd, Lake Zurich - The Chapel will be holding a drive-through Mobile Food Pantry on Saturday, May 16th from 10 a.m. -11:30 a.m. Social distancing guidelines laid out by the government will be enforced and all volunteers must wear masks while in public. Additionally, this will be a true “drive-through” experience to limit contact. Guests will be registered in the parking lot, maintaining a six-foot distance from others, and will stay in their cars the entire time.
ALPINE CHAPEL - 23153 W. Miller Rd, has a food pantry available from 9am-noon every Saturday.
MEAL ASSISTANCE FROM DISTRICT 95 - District 95 is providing bagged grab-and-go breakfast and lunches to any family in need of meal assistance during the COVID-19 related school closures.

ul.li: PICK-UP LOCATION: Lake Zurich High School – Door #12, on the west side of the building. Please enter via the main high school driveway and follow the signs.

PICK-UP DAYS: Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays (Note: Meals WILL be distributed on Friday April 10th despite it being a non-attendance day. Both the meal pickup at the high school and the delivered meals will be offered as usual.)
ELIGIBILITY: Children age 18 and under, and Special Education students age 21 and under.

div.p: On Mondays and Wednesdays, the District will provide 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches per child. On Fridays the District will provide 1 breakfast and 1 lunch per child. Families will be met at the curb and should not exit their vehicles.

If you are unable to pick up the grab-and-go meals but would still like your child to receive meals, we are trying to offer delivery via a school bus drop off at your home. If circumstances allow for a home/neighborhood delivery, we need your information. Please provide information via clicking this link Meal Assistance. Alternatively, you may call 847-540-4943 or email BusinessOffice@lz95.org – leave a message with your contact name, number of children, address and phone number. Delivery is planned to take place from 10am to noon. If we are unable to complete home/neighborhood delivery, we will contact you.

div.address: Below are the communications that have been sent out to District 95 parents, guardians, and students. We will continue to add any additional communications relating to the Coronavirus COVID-19.

p.a: April 24, 2020 - Parent Update - Stay at Home Order Through May
April 18, 2020 - High School Students - Remainder of School Year
April 18, 2020 - K-8 Families - Remainder of School Year
April 18, 2020 - High School Families - Remainder of School Year
April 17, 2020 - Friday Night Lights
April 15, 2020 - Website Unavailable - eLearning Links Provided
April 10, 2020 - Parent Update - End of Week 3, eLearning
April 3, 2020 - Student Update - End of Week 2 , eLearning
April 3, 2020 - Parent Update - End of Week 2, eLearning
March 31, 2020 - Student Update - Extended Stay-at-Home Order
March 31, 2020 - Parent Update - Extended Stay-at-Home Order
March 30, 2020 - Student Update - eLearning Expectations
March 30, 2020 - Parent Update - eLearning: Zoom, Attendance, and Grading
March 29, 2020 - Superintendent Podcast
March 29, 2020 - Parent Update - eLearning Plan and Welcome Back!
March 27, 2020 - Parent Spring Break Update
March 22, 2020 - K-3 Technology - Parent Update
March 20, 2020 - Stay at Home Order, Presumed Positive Case, Food Support, K-3 Tech Survey, How You Can Help
March 19, 2020 - Board of Ed Meeting, Food Support
March 17, 2020 - Parent Update Regarding Communication to Students
March 17, 2020 - Video Message to Secondary Students
March 16, 2020 - eLearning Update
March 15, 2020 - District 95 eLearning Update
March 13, 2020 - eLearning and Additional Closure Information
March 13, 2020 - School Closure - Effective March 16, 2020
March 12, 2020 - Coronavirus Update - Cancellation of Activities
March 11, 2020 - Coronavirus Pandemic; Delayed Start, Travel, Spring Break
March 3, 2020 - Additional Information & D95 Coronavirus Webpage
March 2, 2020 - Verified Patient at Northwest Community Hospital
February 26, 2020 - Prevention, Symptoms, Planning & Preparation
February 11, 2020 - Information from the Illinois Department of Public Health
January 31, 2020 - Information from the Lake County Health Department

h5.strong: How do I access eLearning information?

div.p: We have created an eLearning webpage that is accessible from a number of places.

ul.li: On each school website there is an eLearning link on the menu bar that looks like this:
There is a link to eLearning on the district website under Students.
There is a link in the circle at the bottom of the district home page to eLearning.

h5.strong: Our household doesn't have internet connectivity, what can I do?

p.strong: Internet access options are available for those in need.

div.p: The District provides exterior internet access at all school buildings, look for a white sign reading "Student WiFi access" near the entrance of each building.

Comcast is offering the first 60-days of their Internet Essentials service to qualifying families https://www.internetessentials.com/. Additionally, for the next 60 days, Comcast is offering free WiFi internet access at any of the locations in their extensive network https://www.xfinity.com/mobile/network/map?zip=60047.

h5.b: My family does not have enough food. How can I get help?

div.h5: Please see the section above called "Assistance with Food".

h5.strong: With schools closing, what does this mean for student learning?

div.p: Our staff has been diligently developing an eLearning plan which has been approved by the Lake County Regional Office of Education. This means we are now poised to continue learning even while students and staff are at home. There will be daily expectations of students (with parent support) and staff, however, there will also be flexibility.

We have deployed an eLearning webpage that is available on every school website and the district website. Student and staff expectations are listed there, along with learning resources (by grade level for elementary, through Canvas for secondary), as well as technical support.

h5.strong: How do I talk to my children about Coronavirus?

div.p: In this time of uncertainty, it is very important that parents remain calm and reassuring for their children. Please consider using the social story below (under Helpful Resources) to help you discuss the Coronavirus in an appropriate manner with your children.

h5.strong: What You Can Do for Your Family Members

div.p: The Governor has issued a Stay-at-Home order for the State of Illinois through April 7, 2020. Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95 will be closed through April 7, 2020 (this includes the previously planned week-long spring break). Special education students who attend an outplaced facility will be notified separately regarding the status of those facilities. YMCA before-school and after-school care programs are also be cancelled.
div.div: The order prohibits things like visiting the homes of friends and holding gatherings of any size and closes all nonessential establishments, including most retail, recreation and entertainment businesses. It does NOT prohibit essential activities like going to the grocery store, receiving medical care, or taking your pet for a walk. For more information on what this order means for you, please visit the State of Illinois website.
The Illinois Department of Public Health also recommends the following measures:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing; going to the bathroom; and before eating or preparing food. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick with respiratory symptoms.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
If you have not already done so, discuss influenza vaccination with your health care provider to help protect you against seasonal influenza.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: All District 95 Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

div.p: The Governor has ordered all Illinois schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Lake Zurich Community Unit School District 95 school buildings will remain closed. Students and staff will continue learning from home through our eLearning plan.
